name: Md. Shariar Shadid Shams
body: I think the Radon kills this laptop. With an RTX 3070, even at its pretty high price, I think this would be a winner. AMD really needs to get their DLSS competitor out there, which will help dramatically to get more performance out of their GPUs.

name: Md. Suton Ali
body: I’d call that B-tier since it supports 1 external monitor up to 6K @ 60hz. Legit reason, if you need the physical size. Pixel density of the MBA is better than 1080p or 1440p screens, though.

name: Md. Salim Hossain
body: My baseline recommendation for anyone that wants a laptop is the M1 MacBook Air. At $999 retail (as low as $850 on sale), people really need to justify why they would need to spend more. PC gaming is one good reason; not too many others beyond that.

name: Sangram Hossen
body: I considered an MSI for my kids but was scared away by reports of QA and warranty-support issues — not terrible, but I really needed reliability since they’d be on it for school every day. Asus has a better rep for quality, from what I’ve seen.

name: Md. Papon
body: That one comes with the 6700S, not the 6800S. The 2020 $1499 model had the RTX2060, which was the best GPU, Ryzem 4900HS and 16GB RAM, without an Animatrix lid. There was a $1299 model with a RTX 1660ti in 2020 for $1299, which I think is more comparable to the $1650 model from BestBuy.

name: Khandakar Musaid
body: I pretty well like the G15 (I could do without the Gamer Style, but key travel! matte screen! ports!) and performance is great. The vendor software (and maybe BIOS/firmware, if that caused the mystery drain?) I only notice when it gets in the way. Microsoft Signature AMD Advantage laptop when?
